fields_of_interest: Education and training, Environment, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives: EUROTOX is actively harmonising toxicology education and training, having established the European Register of Toxicologists in 1994 with the goal of providing Europe with well-trained toxicologists to ensure the safety of society in general. Currently the register consists of close to 2,000 members and a total of 20 national registers across Europe.
organisation_name: Federation of European Toxicologists and European Societies of Toxicology (EUROTOX)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: EUROTOX aims to foster toxicology, scientifically and educationally across Europe through the annual scientific congress, workshops, and postgraduate training courses. Furthermore the annual EUROTOX awards (Merit Award and Bo Holmstedt Memorial Lecture) recognise distinguished European toxicologists. Young toxicologists are recognised by the Early Career Award, awarded every year to the best poster presentation at the EUROTOX annual Congress.
relevant_communication:
Commentary published in Elsevier's Toxicology Letters (2016) "The European Registered Toxicologist (ERT): Current status and prospects for advancement" to recognise the ensuring professional competence as well as scientific integrity and credibility of toxicology of ERT professionals across Europe. 
 
Statement Paper published in Elsevier's Toxicology Letters (2016) "Toxicology as an academic discipline in European Universities on the status of Toxicology as an academic discipline in Europe" to draw attention to the critical importance of the discipline in protecting the health of consumers, workers and the environment.
